item.title: Shutdown stocks to watch: These companies get a bulk of their revenues from the government
item.description: A protracted impasse could crimp backlog conversion, slow awards and weigh on cash flow for government services firms, according to TD Cowen.

item.title: Here's what major Wall Street banks are telling clients to do about the shutdown
item.description: Wall Street banks largely told clients to expect a typical short shutdown and bet on a comeback in stocks if there's any major weakness.

item.title: Barclays downgrades AT&T to equal weight, says upside is limited after recent gains
item.description: AT&T has outperformed this year, climbing 24%, but is likely to face a more challenging environment ahead, the bank said.

item.title: Carvana gets an upgrade from Jefferies, which says momentum for car retailer is picking up
item.description: Shares of the online car retailer have already outperformed this year, up more than 85%. Jefferies expects there's further upside.

item.title: Here are Wednesday's biggest analyst calls: Nvidia, Apple, Tesla, Delta, Carvana, Coinbase & more
item.description: Here are Wednesday's biggest calls on Wall Street.
